CatDescriptText: Mr. R. S. Hervey, retired, New Wilmington and Mrs. Ella Brandon, housewife, Lowell Street, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 23, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think race relations are improving or worsening in Pittsburgh?" Mr. R. S. Hervey's answer reads: "I think they are improving."  Mrs. Ella Brandon's answer reads: "Improving, because they are not like they used to be."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of R.S. Hervey wearing dark fedora, eyeglasses, paisley tie, and herringbone coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Ella Brandon wearing dark head scarf, dark coat with fur collar, and dark gloves, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
